column3: Verified that the key matches the signature used in https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gitian.sigs/pull/620\n\nACK 6a07f33
Hmm... unsure.\nKey refers to btcplt.org (Bitcoin Platinum).\nI just want to make sure if the key merged into the Core repository will not be used to leverage other things (indirect advertising).

Unrelated note: Since most keys are outdated and keeping them up to date is somewhat of a pain, what about removing all keys and only adding a list of full key fingerprints, to be fed into `gpg` for later download. Right now we need to connect to some pgp key server anyway, as some keys are timed out.

>  Since most keys are outdated and keeping them up to date is somewhat of a pain, what about removing all keys and only adding a list of full key fingerprints, 

Yes, that would be a good idea. Have only the key-fingerprints in the main repo.
